content:
Ladies and Gentlemen,

I'm Shabbir Degani, the artist behind this innovative and thought-provoking series of paintings that showcase the astrolabe. As a tool that has been used for centuries to measure and make sense of the world, the astrolabe is an extension of our intelligence and our desire to understand our surroundings.

From the earliest moments in human history, we have sought to use our minds and our hands to push beyond the limits of what we know. Whether it's through the invention of tools and machines, the development of new technologies, or the creation of art and culture, humans have always sought to leave our mark on the world and to expand the boundaries of our knowledge and experience.

In my art, I sought to capture this connection between the astrolabe and the human spirit. By merging the human face with parts and drawings from the astrolabe, I aimed to show that our tools and our very selves are inextricably linked. Our tools are not just external objects, but extensions of our own intelligence, creativity, and capability. They reflect our values, our goals, and our sense of purpose, and they allow us to harness our minds and our hands to achieve things that would otherwise be impossible.

The astrolabe, as an instrument that was used to measure and understand the stars and the world around us, represents the human drive to create and explore. By exploring the connection between the astrolabe and the human experience, I aimed to shed new light on the significance of this tool and the role it has played in human history. I hope that my art inspires new perspectives on the relationship between technology, creativity, and the human experience, and that it highlights the deep, underlying connection between our tools and the very essence of who we are.

Thank you for joining me at the opening of this gallery show. I hope that you enjoy the paintings, and that you leave here with a new appreciation for the astrolabe and the power of art to inspire new perspectives on our world.
